intro: Oligosporus brachylobus, commonly known as the short-stalked sporegrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its root system is fibrous, allowing it to thrive in well-drained soils. Oligosporus brachylobus is often found in open habitats such as fields and disturbed areas.
